tClass.description: A class reference is the SKOS preferred label of a class. This label MUST be unique within the transitive closure of the vocabulary referenced by the manifest.

tUnit.description: A unit is referenced by its QUDT symbol. It MUST be unique within the QUDT units defined in the vocabularies declared in the manifest.

tStringValue.description: A literal string in UTF-8 encoding.

tDecimalValue.description: A number value stored as an XSD decimal.

tDoubleValue.description: A number value stored as an XSD double.

tFloatValue.description: A number value stored as an XSD float.

tDateTimeValue.description: All timestamps MUST be in ISO8601 date/time format.

tDateTimeStampValue.description: All timestamps MUST be in ISO8601 date/time format.

@componentDatatype.description: Subset of XSD datatypes supported in simple models

tIRIValue.description: A literal IRI reference, not to be confused with a resource reference (tResource)

tDateTimeStampValue.description: All timestamps MUST be in ISO8601 date/time format.

tDateValue.description: All timestamps MUST be in ISO8601 date format.

tTimeValue.description: All timestamps MUST be in ISO8601 time format.

tDurationValue.description: All durations MUST be in ISO8601 duration format.

tObject.description: An JSON object with properties. This will be mapped to an RDF resource, which can be a blank node.

tArray.description: An JSON array. This will be mapped to a list, which can be a blank node.

tNamed.description: A reference to an arbitrary RDF resource identified by a SKOS preferred label. The label MUST be unique.

tResource.description: A reference to an arbitrary RDF resource identified by an IRI. The mapping to RDF will introduce a node reference instead of a literal IRI.

tReference.description: A reference to an object within an JSON document using JSON pointers.

mixedItem.description: A schema for a polymorphic array item, which requires that each item has a @type declaration

orderedItem.description: A schema for an array item, that is ordered in a not-natural way. This means that it MUST have an explicit @index property stating the position. The index value is a strict positive 32bit signed integer (excluding 0).
